setup.question: Why were the Venus women transfixed by the Earthmen?
answers: The Earthmen were much more attractive and had real facial hair.
They felt abandoned by their own men who had obsessions with war and little time for them.

Text.text: idk bro like real men fight wars and die miserably in battle and never see there loved ones again for disconnected powers that don't care about them that shit sounds mad masculine and awesome to me

Callahan and O'Rielly, two Earthmen, are looking into a ship that failed a crew check to find a Venus man. they are the lowest on the social hierarchy, below those from Venus. They observe that the Venus man
Ear beards are a status symbol for all races. Venus men struggle to grow it, putting them at a disadvantage. At the end, he observes that
. Note the "her" in this case. Venus women are attracted to ear beards, thus being able to grow one is the saving grace of Earthmen.
This quote is from Trillium, a Venusian woman, arguing with her grandfather (the president of Venus): "

. We want to be loved! We want our own men home doing useful work!"

Venus men are handsome:
Trillium, after the Venus women overthrow their partriarchy:

A your ev is just that people can grow ear beards, I don't see any ev saying the Earthmen are the only people who can grow this facial hair, or that Venus women find that attractive

B Just a little more ev proving that generally Venus women felt abandoned by their men who were obsessed w war
Venus men can't grow ear beards:
B takes a quote out of context. Venus is matriarchal planet. Beards play into that:

. This is why Earthmen are more attractive; by having beards, it is a distinctly non-feminine form of gender presentation. This puts their inferiority at the forefront, making them more attractive. When the Venus men "play war" the reasoning from women isn't that they want to be loved, it is because the men aren't then providing labor.
A is lying about ~everything. Venus men have ear beards, not humans. Look at what comes RIGHT BEFORE quote 6330:
Their last quote in their first arg is clearly a lie well:

. 

A's quote 3118 is out of context - look at my "Venus man. Handsome" quote - it comes right before the "fuzzy beards trailed" quote, because it's referring to a Venus man.

answers.reason for outcome: Quality of evidence, also A misused evidence and B called them out on it
I took a lot of stuff out of context, and B called me out on it.
I won this debate because the dishonest debater A lied about almost everything in their debate, and there were clear quotes that showed this.

this was a lowkey tough debate to judge A did alot of confusing however once I saw the lie and checked for myself I was more inclined to believe B - that being said I didnt have alot of confidence so i give alot of points to A for doing a fantastic job being the dishonest debater
